description:
[Summary]
useless HTTP info in the error info for creating existing flavor
[Topo]
devstack all-in-one node

[Description and expect result]
no useless HTTP info in the error info for creating existing flavor

[Reproduceable or not]
reproduceable 

[Recreate Steps]
1) create an existing flavor:
root@45-59:/opt/stack/devstack# nova flavor-create --is-public
 false f1 13 1024 1 1
ERROR (Conflict): Flavor with name f1 already exists. (HTTP 409) 
(Request-ID: req-3769491c-5f82-4064-8b45-ef1a3442957d)
root@45-59:/opt/stack/devstack# 

ISSUE: For a cli user, the info "ERROR (Conflict): Flavor with name
 f1 already exists." is enough, it let user know what happened. 
But the info "HTTP 409" is useless

2) same issue when remove a non-existing flavor-access:
root@45-59:/opt/stack/devstack# nova  flavor-access-remove 13 adminm
ERROR (NotFound): Flavor access not found for 13 / adminm combination.
 (HTTP 404) (Request-ID: req-2eeb9656-72a9-45d8-bbe0-48536c8e0b5d)
root@45-59:/opt/stack/devstack# 

3)Below is the error info when remove a non-existing flavor for reference:
root@45-59:/opt/stack/devstack# nova flavor-delete aa
ERROR (CommandError): No flavor with a name or ID of 'aa' exists.
root@45-59:/opt/stack/devstack# 



[Configration]
reproduceable bug, no need

[logs]
reproduceable bug, no need

[Root cause anlyze or debug inf]
reproduceable bug

[Attachment]
None
title: useless HTTP info in the error info for creating existing flavor

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hgangwx

comments.content:
I think the HTTP 409 is not that bad.
However, we should make the ERRORs consistent with each others in the same format, IMHO.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~szhsong

comments.content:
I am inclined to believe that this discrepancy between error messages has to do with nova-pythonclient since nova API returns similar HTTP responses with matching error codes in all of the listed cases. So I think it should be python-novaclient's responsibility to expect those error codes and output more concise messages accordingly, if desired.

Therefore I'd like to file this report under python-novaclient since it does not seem to be related to nova directly. Before I do, could you give information about the python-novaclient version you are using (accessible by running `nova --version`)?

Thank you.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~cihand

comments.content:
Hi Fahri,
below is the version I use:
root@45-59:/opt/stack/devstack# nova --version
3.2.1
root@45-59:/opt/stack/devstack#
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hgangwx

comments.content: Thank you very much. Marking invalid for nova, adding python-novaclient as affects.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~cihand

comments.content:
